page.title: 08INTERESTING PEOPLE (BEWDLEY)
page.content: {Cyril Garbett}is well known and liked by most people in Bewdley. He is often seen in the streets chatting and telling jokes. He was born in Lax Lane, in 1913.{Stanley Baldwin,} Britain's Prime Minister in the 30's lived just down the road. Cyril left Lax Lane National School at 13 and worked in a mill at Kidderminster. Often he had to walk the 3 miles to work to light all the gas lamps. Often Bewdley was flooded and Cyril would rescue people in the council boat. He failed his medical during World War II so was the town's{ARP man.}After the war and until his early retirement, through an accident, he was the local refuse collector. Cyril still thinks Bewdley is a beautiful place to live in but despairs of all the litter that visitors leave lying about.
